ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.localization

Class LightLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.localization.LightLocalizer

  • public class LightLocalizer
extends Object
    This class uses the color sensor to correct to odometer's x, y and theta by evaluating the distance of the robot to a cross-section in the grid.
    Author:
    Kevin Laframboise & Wenjie Wei

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double[] angles
      Records the angle at which a line was detected.

      Sample provider for the color sensor.
      private int counter
      Counts the number of lines detected during sweep operation.

      Debugging flag.
      private double dTheta
      Angle delta between the odometer's zero heading and true zero heading, in radians.

      Distance in x between the robot and the y-axis, in cm.
      private double dy
      Distance in y between the robot and the x-axis, in cm.
      private double gridX
      X coordinate of the intersection around which localization is occurring.

      Y coordinate of the intersection around which localization is occurring.

      Left motor driving the robot, used in the sweep operation.

      Buffer array for the color sensor data.
      static double LS_TO_CENTER
      Distance between the light sensor and the center of rotation of the robot, in cm.
      private static EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor
      Right motor driving the robot, used in the sweep operation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightLocalizer

        public LightLocalizer(SampleProvider colorSampler,
                      float[] lightData,
                      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                      boolean debug)
        Creates a LightLocalizer object with given properties.
        Parameters:
        colorSampler -
        lightData -
        leftMotor -
        rightMotor -
        debug, - setting this to true will cause the algorithm to print more verbose information to the console and will require the user to press a button after each step of the localization.

    • Method Detail

      • sweep

        private void sweep()
        Performs a 360 degrees sweep in order to detect grid lines.

      • localize

        public boolean localize(int startingCorner)
        Localizes with consideration for the starting corner. It localizes at every corner as if it were corner 0 and then flips signs accordingly when updating the odometer. Using this method will cause the robot to move until the color sensor crosses the next grid line intersection in the positive x and y axis. Be careful when using this near forbidden areas.
        Parameters:
        startingCorner - [0,3].
        Returns:
        true if localization is successful.

      • localize

        public boolean localize()
        Performs light localization by assuming that this is not the initial localization. Using this method will cause the robot to move until the color sensor crosses the next grid line intersection in the positive x and y axis. Be careful when using this near forbidden areas.
        Returns:
        true if localization is successful.

      • localize

        public boolean localize(boolean initialLocalization)
        Performs light localization according to whether this is the initial localization or not. Using this method will cause the robot to move until the color sensor crosses the next grid line intersection in the positive x and y axis. Be careful when using this near forbidden areas.
        Parameters:
        initialLocalization - true if this is the first light localization performed.
        Returns:
        true if localization was successful.

      • adjust

        private void adjust(char axis)
        Drives the robot towards the given axis until a grid line is detected then backwards 21 cm.
        Parameters:
        axis - x, y, o. 'o' stands for origin, meaning that the robot will be driven in a 45 deg angle towards the intersection. 'o' should only be used when the robot is roughly at the center of a square.

      • getRedIntensity

        public static float getRedIntensity()
        Returns the median of a group of sample from the color sensor as the detected color.
        Returns:
        color intensity detected

      • getGridX

        public double getGridX()
        Returns:
        gridX

      • getGridY

        public double getGridY()
        Returns:
        gridY
